message: maybe
Well, not sure why, but ...
Just use emit << js-will-not-get-hork'd >> syntax instead
#edsnotbitteratall
Instead of using the emit <| your-js-code-here |> syntax
I'm just say'in
much suckage. :(
I got milk!
srsly what was the error
If I may offer the following tip ... if in the course of coding, test & debugging you begin to receive parsing errors at runtime and you have JavaScript in your rules ...
I may be of assistince here
assistance
please elaborate
@alexkolson sorry, I'm a bit irritated with this one. I finally reverted to my working code base from this morning and line by line added coded until it broke.
This might save you 5 hours of debugg'in

Then I performed about 12 different test, and it appears that the runtime was trying to expand and parse a variable that had a bunch of HTML in it ... BARF! Now why in the heck it didn't barf on the 1st instance of the variable I will never know, but it sure as sunshine barf'd all over the 2nd instance. Change the syntax, no more barf. Life is good, well, it's better.
Thanks for the therapy session, I'll go back to coding now :)
@alexkolson Thanks, but I believe Phil has a much better handle on KRL than I
I have a theory about the issue that I encountered ... it's my old friend "//"
I can't be certain since the JS was not written to the log. But it's a pretty good theory.

just repeat this mantra: "Ed is the man. Ed is the man. Ed is a KRL MVP. ED is a KRL MVP. ED is to KRL as Journey is to 80's rock-ballads. Ed is to KRL as Journey is to 80's rock-ballads. Ed is to KRL as John Resig is to Javascript."
When Phil Windley needs KRL help, he comes to Ed.
Good! Make 'em walk the plank until we can get our parser (*&(&* together!! :)
Oh noes! The parsed-as-comment bug still lives?!
Since I was using clown hats, the parser try'd to help and for some reason looked into the string variable in my JS, found "//".
I'm done with clown hats for now! Give me emit << js >> or give me death!
Aarrrggg!
FWIW, here's the direction I was heading at noon when it all blew up on me .... http://www.hvr.me/ctest.html#card/edorcutt

Too legit to quit.

Wow! Just received a Google Alert that this thread has been indexed. That was quick!
Ed, being able to dynamically show the hvrme stuff is pretty friggin awesome!
Ed, please make sure we get a good bug submitted on this. I don't like that we've got the // bug licked yet and we should be able to now that we have the new parser.
@windley I'm on it! I want to do all I can to kill this bug dead! :)
